of Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2011. Both on-premises and cloud-based versions of the platform will be available in 40 markets and 41 languages starting Feb. 28. A Jan. 17 statement by Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer emphasized Dynamics CRM's familiar user experience, enabling greater collaboration, streamlining of processes and access to real-time data. Microsoft finds itself locked in fierce battle for CRM market-share with Salesforce.com and Oracle, both of which have shown little hesitation in both updating their products and sniping at their rivals. With rumors swirling around Westminster earlier this week that Mr. Andy Coulson had already offered to resign, the prime minister publicly expressed full confidence in his aide. Obviously, when he was editor of the News of the World, bad things happened at the newspaper, and when he found out about those things, he resigned, and that was the right thing to do, Mr. David Cameron told BBC radio's "Today" program.
